body_html:
This still occurs on tensorflow 1.8.0 CPU and Ubuntu 16.04, g++ 5.4.0.

Is there an alternative way to submit work to the intra-op threadpool for custom ops? It also might be worth modifying the Adding an Op docs to indicate that Shard might not work or provide an alternatve.

This still occurs on tensorflow 1.8.0 CPU and Ubuntu 16.04, g++ 5.4.0.
Is there an alternative way to submit work to the intra-op threadpool for custom ops? It also might be worth modifying the Adding an Op docs to indicate that Shard might not work or provide an alternatve.
body:
This still occurs on tensorflow 1.8.0 CPU and Ubuntu 16.04, g++ 5.4.0.

Is there an alternative way to submit work to the intra-op threadpool for custom ops? It also might be worth modifying the [Adding an Op](https://www.tensorflow.org/extend/adding_an_op) docs to indicate that Shard might not work or provide an alternatve.
